data.title: Time to up your game!
data.text: Roanoke has a great dining scene and Lucky has been a trendsetter, but it's time to up your game.  Restaurants with a good cocktail program are locavore food are popping up everywhere. Lucky started with a strong, well-executed concept, but I don't think it's menu has changed since Day 1.  Other local restaurants share you bartenders, offer roasted oysters and marrow bones.  Don't let all of Roanoke become sameness!  Offer a seasonal menu! One or two off menu specials isn't enough.  Opening Fortunato to offer a slightly different concept isn't enough. It time for Lucky to step up. Get Lucky!

data.title: Top notch food, service, atmosphere
data.text: An unexpectedly outstanding meal in Roanoke, VA. Everything we ordered was delicious,  artfully presented. Made with local, fresh ingredients. Decor is artsy and warm. Service was outstanding. One of the best meals I've had.

data.title: Great restaurant in a great little city
data.text:
Visited 10/28/16 for a late snack
What a great find to finish off our tour of the South. Once again, my wife was searching Yelp regarding where we should eat in Roanoke, where we were stopping for the night. 
It was kind of late for us (8:30pm) and the place did have a pretty full house, but we were shown a table right away.
Since it was kinda late for us (we like to eat early, more like 5 - 6pm) we opted to get a few appetizers and share a meal, We chose their cheese board, duck liver pate and a bowl of mussels. One of the chefs (at least he was in chef garb) delivered the goodies to us and explained the different cheeses to us. This was a very nice touch, but since I lost the hearing in my left ear and the place was very loud, I didn't really hear his descriptions of the cheeses. But... it's the thought that counts, right? But do take note that this excellent restaurant is a bit loud. Your conversation will probably include a lot of "WHAT?"  
Anyway, all the cheeses (served with caramelized onions, sliced pickled red peppers and some nice sliced french baguette. The duck pate also came with the caramelized onions, sliced, pickled red peppers the sliced french baguette and some pickles. 
This has to be one of my favorite meals. I mean I could eat this anytime... with a nice glass of malbec or pinot noir... Yum. Not the healthiest meal I grant you, but so very satisfying. 
We wolfed down that all the cheeses, pate and bread and the mussels... served with some garlicky cristinis in a nice light buttery broth. Excellent. 
Everything was so good we decided we had to try one more dish and went with the mushrooms and gnocchi. This was served in an excellent Swiss chard pesto. This pesto was really rather good and I'm not a big fan of Swiss chard, which is kind of ironic because my heritage is Swiss. But I do make pesto at home... but the 'normal' kind with basil. I really was surprised how much I liked this pesto. I'm going to have try this at home soon. 
Everyone in this place was very friendly and helpful. Our waitress, rather than grabbing the 'empty' bowl from the mussels (still with a lot of broth) asked if we would like some more cristini... which we said yes to. That was a first. I've never been asked that after finishing off mussels. 
Roanoke seems to be a really great little city. We did drive around a bit and are thinking we might take a ride down here to see more of this city. I'm just hoping Lucky will be open (and not on vacation)

data.title: Delicious Creative Fun
data.text:
This is an excellent restaurant with delicious and creatively prepared food.
It is creative without being weird. We got carried away with appetizers- old salt oysters, bread plate with lovely fresh accoutrements, roasted marrow bones(OMG) and shishito peppers. We split a steak because we had too many apps. Sooo good! We also split a lovely creamy chocolate dessert.
Cocktails were excellent. This was our second visit and it was just as good as our first. This is a casual yet celebratory restaurant.

data.title: Innovative with attentive service
data.text:
I talked about 10 people into trying this place and then worried that it wouldn't live up to the billing. It actually turned out to be better. The only complaint I heard -- and it was mild -- was about the cost. I guess it is all relative, but compared to great restaurants in other cities, this was moderate.

My appetizer was a goose pate with a watermelon slaw that was delicious. I chose a main course of bass, wild caught in Maryland, with a combo of vegetables. Yum. My companion across the table had fried chicken and mashed potatoes. Very conventional but very good. 

I wasn't familiar with much that was on the brief wine list, but the malbec was spicy and a treat.

data.title: Dinner date
data.text: Anniversary dinner while traveling. The drinks were amazing. Atmosphere great!  The food was also very good. Hip fun bar scene. Truly enjoyable.

data.title: Dinner at Lucky's
data.text: We had a nice dining experience at Lucky's while staying at Roanoke Hotel and Convention Center (a Hilton Curio collection hotel).  Made a last minute reservation on Open Table for 8:30pm but ended up walking by the restaurant while out for a stroll around 530pm.  Noticed  all the empty tables and decided to eat early.  Unfortunately all the tables were reserved (apparently the restaurant gets slammed beginning around 6:00pm) and we opted to sit at the bar (full service dinner menu).  Service was great, bartenders were gracious and experienced.  Good selection of crafted cocktails.  Dinner menu was very good as well.  Reasonable pricing, dinner for two with drinks and tip around $90.  Overall a very pleasant dining experience with very good service, food and beverages.

data.title: Happy to find Lucky
data.text: I'm glad this restaurant was walking distance from where I had spent the day on business travel. I was steered there after telling a colleague I was in the mood for good food in a relaxed setting near downtown Roanoke. Great tip.  Everything on the menu looked good. Megan, my friendly server, mentioned her favorites-- the mussels (appetizer), pork shoulder, and diver's scallops( entrees). I opted for the scallops, after starting with a duck liver paté (accompanied by house-made pickles, chutney, onions and mustard). Suffice to say everything was delicious well-prepared and beautifully presented. (If you're looking to get your minimum daily veggies from the side dishes, you might want to know that whatever is listed with the entrées tends to come in garnish-sized portions.) The service was great. The setting is creatively comfortable while still upscale-- lots of old brick, repurposed antique doors, butcher paper on wooden tables, eclectic light fixtures....  This is a restaurant I would hope to revisit on my next trip to Roanoke-- a "lucky" discovery.

data.title: Great food great time
data.text: This is a must in Roanoke...we visited on a tip from the hotel...I had a fall cocktail and my hubby had a local beer..both were very yummy...we had the bread plate for our appetizer...the garlic evoo and the cheese were delectable...my hubby got the special for the night which was the grouper...let's just say his plate was very clean within minutes...I had the buttermilk chicken...the only thing left on my plate were the bones from the chicken and some of the greens the entree came with...our server was very attentive...the ambiance is trendy.I would definitely would go back again....

data.title: Eat here.
data.text: Small, quirky, friendly  great service,  good food.  Had the special  last night.  Pleasantly  surprised.   Grouper and kohlrabi..complex flavors, nicely  plated, perfect  portion.  A little loud  for conversation.

data.title: Just lucky to digest here
data.text:
We were in Roanoke overnight and went downtown to find a place to dine. We came across another couple reading a menu outside a restaurant and as we were reading over their shoulder they told us about Lucky. We walked in on a Friday evening and were seated immediately.

What a nice place with a lively bar and an interesting cocktail menu.

We had oysters for our appetizer, roasted fish and scallops for our entree and cake for desert. All we wonderful. This place uses local ingredients and vendors. The food was very tasty and well plated.

If we were to go back to Roanoke we would make sure to get a reservation and dine there again.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: We had a lovely dinner at Lucky's.  The ribeye was cooked to perfection and my wife loved the scallops. It was very vibrant and the service was excellent.

data.title: Always enjoy
data.text: I have been here about 4 times and each time it has been really good. Not amazing but good. The appetizers and salads have been more exciting than the entrees.

data.title: Great Bar and Food
data.text: On a recent stay in Roanoke my wife and I had dinner at Lucky two out of three nights. Didn't go the third night only because we figured we needed to expand our horizons. The food is eclectic and delicious with specials every night. Everyone should try the marrow bones for an appetizer and follow that with a "luge". The bartender can explain what that is. We sat at the bar both nights and got incredible service from the bartender. Reservations are highly recommended, even for bar seating.

data.title: Lively, great food and cocktails
data.text: Beautiful old school bar in a high ceiling room with a textured tin finish, this room filled with a lively crowd both at the bar and tables. And this is on a random Tuesday night! Wine, beer and extensive specialty cocktails are adeptly handled. Food is excellent, seafood perhaps a specialty but the buttermilk chicken my wife had was perfect with mashed potatoes to die for. If in downtown Roanoke, check it out!

data.title: Amazing all around experience.
data.text: In town for the weekend, visiting from Asheville NC.  We had reservations at the bar, which turned out to be to perfect.  We met the owner who served us delicious cocktails and made sure our entire experience was top notch.  The creativity of the bar using smoke infused glasses and homemade ginger beer set the tone for the evening.  Our entrees were also amazing.  I had the scallops and my husband had the grouper.  Both were cooked to perfection with amazing flavor combinations.  All in all a wonderful dinning experience.  A lot of locals were eating there. Everyone was super friendly.  We will be back!

data.title: Great Drinks, Friendly Staff, Entertained by People Watching
data.text:
Stopped by on Saturday, 08/06/16, for some craft cocktails - a passion of mine.

  Very nice setup, long bar with nice wood top, comfortable chairs with wingbacks and a lovely tin ceiling (picture).

  Excellent menu for drinks and the taste met or beat the description.  Very friendly and attentive bartenders who were having a lot of fun with the regulars.  It wasn't a quiet crowd - lots of fun being had.  The dining room is separate but I came for drinks so I can't speak to the food or dining experience.

  Pleased to see a selection of Amari - limited I was informed only by the ABC rules.

 Great place to go for singles or couples and I'll be sure to be back.

data.title: Very noisy
data.text: The food, service, and cocktails were good.  However, I had to practically scream to make myself heard.  The noise reverberates throughout the restaurant due to the acoustics.

data.title: good food, atmosphere
data.text: went based on other's recommendations, and was very happy i did.  nice salad, and braised pork shoulder was falling apart and delicious.  went for the bourbon bread pudding, and it was very good (not the best i've had, but the bar is pretty high, as we used to have a restaurant near us that had a phenomenal bread pudding).  Service was attentive and not overbearing, and overall it was a nice end to a long day of traveling

data.title: Our favorite "road trip" bar
data.text: My husband and I discovered Lucky a year ago while visiting Roanoke during a road  trip from FL to Pittsburgh.  We had made reservations in advance and was told by the hotel concierge that we were "lucky" to get reservations.   We arrived a little early for our reservation and decided to go to bar until table was ready, well, once we sat at the bar, met some of the "bartender-Mixologists" and watched hem do their presentations (Truly the movie Cocktail could take a lesson from these guys!)  We  were greeted and presented with an old LP record album and thought "what is this"  once we pulled the record out of the cover the menu was on the label of the album - we thought - how cool is this!!!  It only got better from there --  the drinks, the friendliness of the customers and bartenders, plus their performance in making the drinks was awesome - we then decided not to take our table and sit and have dinner at the bar, well the food was outstanding!  We could not find  fault with anything in this little place.  In fact what I just wrote happened a year ago and we just returned this evening and had a complete return performance and fantastic meal.  Ryan and Nexus were fabulous and we hope it will not be another year before we make our next return visit.  If you ever find yourself in Roanoke, please give Lucky a try - you will leave the "Lucky" one!!!
